column3: Field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed
Learning from labeled data with specified input and output
Learning from unlabeled data with no specified input and output
Learning through trial-and-error interactions with an environment to maximize reward
Subset of Machine Learning that utilizes artificial neural networks to model and solve complex problems
Neural networks specifically designed for image and video analysis
Neural networks designed for sequential data analysis, such as speech recognition or text translation
Neural networks that generate new data samples similar to the input data
Branch of AI that allows computers to understand and interpret human language
Analyzing text to determine the emotion behind it
Identifying and categorizing named entities in text, such as people, places, and organizations
Translating text from one language to another
Using AI to program and control robots for various tasks
Utilizing robots in manufacturing and production environments
Robots designed to assist in medical procedures, such as surgeries
Using robotics and AI to create self-driving cars and other autonomous vehicles
